Description: Deep bowl of Nile silt pottery with flat base and slightly convex sides expanding to flared lip. The exterior is coated with red slip, burnished, and decorated with designs in a creamy-white pigment. The paint has worn away or is obscured by salt in most places, but motifs include horizontally hatched triangles around part of the base, vegetal motifs and two large chevrons with scalloped edges depending from the rim. The interior rim is slipped and polished and possibly decorated with white painted chevrons. The rest of the interior is untreated.
Curator's comments: Petrie’s White Cross line (C) ware. Published: G. Graff, Les peintures sur vases de Naqada I–Naqada II: Nouvelle approche sémiologique de l’iconographie prédynastique, Leuven (2009), cat. no. 105
Condition: poor, salt damage to surface, paint faded.
